Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi R
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I recently decided to go to Napa for my 29th birthday celebration. We were so excited to find RiverPointe. The rooms are spacious and like little cottages. There is a large and comfortable bed in the bedroom and the couch pulls out into a bed as well. The blankets are soft, warm and cuddly. I loved the little towel animals they made, it made me feel like I was on a cruise. We took full advantage of the kitchen space. We cooked breakfast every morning and even grilled an amazing dinner. We went to the wineries the Manager James suggested and had a blast! I was surprised at how informed the staff was about the Napa area. When we weren't out sightseeing we were lounging at the pool and hot tub. It was a definite plus that the pool was heated. We can not wait to come again! Thanks RiverPointe!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Napa and at RiverPointe”
Reviews.Author: phylmokap424
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Napa and at RiverPointe. We exchanged into this resort through Interval International and were not disappointed! While the cottages are, in fact mobile trailers, once you learn about the area being a flood zone, it makes perfect sense to have the units transportable. The resort is very conveniently located to both Highway 29 and the Silverado Trail making visiting literally hundreds of wineries very easy to do. The staff at the resort was exceptional and Marilynn, the activities director is FABULOUS. Her energy and enthusiasm is contagious, not to mention the wonderful orientation breakfast she organized on Monday or the three FREE wine tasting evenings she arranged during the week. In addition, she had contracted with Hector Gomez of American VIP Limo for a 6 hour tour in a stretch limo which included visits to 5 different wineries, plus a stop for lunch, all for $65/pp. What a fantastic day!! All in all, we would certainly recommend RiverPointe to anyone interested in visiting Napa and Sonoma and we will definitely return in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Resort, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: rose h
Reviews.Content: Came to Napa for the Kingston Trio concert with my honey and was very please with the resort. It was very clean and had a very friendly staff. Look forward to staying again during the summer months to enjoy the pool and spa. Would recommend this resort to anyone looking for a nice peaceful stay in the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget unreliable Excurstions”
Reviews.Author: floydfunster
Reviews.Content: All promises no follow up. Talk a big show about being respected by Wineries and have special deals. No!!. The worst time ever. Food is less than Mc E Dees. All about SALES and pressure to sign on doted line. No REAL concern for guest, repeat over and over how good they are about patting themselves on the backs. Soooo no sincere. Rooms cold and drafty, surprise Napa allows them to operate in the city limits. Property like a Oklahoma end of the road flop house. YMCA would be better. All about getting into your pockets, excursions are a joke...wine tour(undrinkable) city tours(no points of interest). Don't waste your time or money.....Floyd

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: catwoman03
Reviews.Content: I came to River Pointe with my sister, who is my very best friend, and her husband. While her husband spent a few days with his son in San Francisco, Vicki and I took the Napa Wine Train tour (some of the best food and jovial company, and great wine I've experienced) and loved it. What made the entire week one of our best time share experiences yet was the very friendly and accomodating staff (Marilyn, the concierge, went out of her way to treat us with a wonderful, FULL, cooked breakfast on our first full day, two free wine tastings and lectures from the vintners on two days of the week, AND a wonderful dinner for "whoever" of us wanted to join in at Cuvee Restaurant....some of the most fun and frolic we've had in a while. All the staff at River Pointe went out of their way to help us totally enjoy the trip. The cottages themselves (we had one full and one studio) were delightful and felt more like home...helping us to truly relax every moment we were in them...which wasn't that often because we were in SF two days, up and down the valley several days, and just enjoying every moment. The cottages were well stocked with all we needed for the week (dishes, linens, VERY comfortable beds) and we bought enough groceries we weren't eating out all that often. We will definitely come back, in fact can't wait, and enjoy the wine country beauty and hospitality all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, Friendly, and Clen”
Reviews.Author: Lattebud
Reviews.Content: My partner and I, as well as another couple, had an event on the Napa Valley Wine train and opted to stay at RiverPointe. Upon arrival, we were a bit taken aback by the fact the the "cottages" were actually mobile homes. Even though we were several hours early, the front desk checked us in quickly and had us in our unit. The unit itself was what one would expect from a single wide mobile home. For the 4 of us for one evening, it was not an issue. The unit was very well maintained and cleaned. In fact, I dropped my keys on the floor, got down on the floor to get them out from under the table, and found the corners were spotless. Linens, kitchen utentils, and other items provided were in good shape. The primary bedroom bed was very comfortable. But the sofabed wasn't so comfortable. A great deal of care was taken to ensure guests had all the information they needed, down to the light switches being marked, extensive directions how to connect to the free WiFI, and instructions how to use the TV remote, that included premium channels. The front desk did everything they could to make the experience more pleaseant. There is a WalMart within about a 7-10 minute walk and the Wine Train and Oxbow Market was a 20 minute stroll. Knowing we were walking home from our event and not having to have a designated driver made for a much more relaxed evening. If someone asked about it, I would say it was clean, quiet, comfortable, good service, convenient location, and, if offered, a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet accomodation, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Wyndwhystle
Reviews.Content: Units are small cottage trailers, suitable for couples but any more than two would be pushing it. We are cyclists and appreciate the river front bike path next to the property that leads to the Silverado Trail and gives a rider access to all of the Napa Valley. Our unit was clean on arrival, towels and trash were taken care of regularly (we were on a time share exchange). It would be nice if the Wifi actually worked, and the $8 Resort fee seemed unnecessary for guests who did not use any facilities or attend any of the activities. Why not charge those who actually attend your wine tastings and breakfasts? We already pay an $800 annual fee at our home resort.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Inlander_WillTravel
Reviews.Content: I visited this resort Sunday, 3/25/12, through Saturday, 3/31/12, and I have to say that RiverPointe exceeded my expectations! Arriving in the early afternoon, the friendly front desk checked us in upon arrival, which started the vacation off on a good note, since we had been on the road for 8 hours! And, the front desk personnel continued to be friendly and helpful throughout our visit. We were given Unit #49, which is towards the front of the property near the clubhouse. The unit was clean and tidy. Apparently, this unit is essentially a 'single-wide' mobile home, which consisted of a living room (sleeper sofa), kitchen area, bathroom, and bedroom (queen-size bed). Wonderful!! ALL APPLIANCES AND UTILITIES WERE IN EXCELLENT WORKING CONDITION - hot water got hot, and quickly, heater heated the unit, both flatscreens worked, as well as their respective remote controls. We did not have to make one phone call to maintenance during our stay. RiverPointe has a FANTASTIC resort activities program, which included THREE free evening wine tasting events, a free welcome breakfast, and several day trips available for purchase. We purchased the San Francisco limo tour (major SF sights in a day), which was fantastic! A shout out to 'Hector' of American VIP Limo - GREAT TOUR and GREAT SERVICE!!! There was only one negative: the fitness room needs serious upgrading! It consists of a treadmill, an elliptical machine, a stationary bike, a flatscreen TV, and a scale.

Reviews.Title: “Not my idea of a resort....”
Reviews.Author: wishIwerent_here
Reviews.Content: The "condos" here are trailers that have been driven in and parked. An area of the grounds is either under construction or deconstruction, I'm not sure which. We had a one bedroom condo which is marketed for four people, but was a little tight for two teenagers and their parents. The bedroom had so little space between the end of the bed and the built in unit that the drawers wouldn't fully open and it was difficult to pass through to the far side of the bed. The spa next to the pool was closed with a sign (on March 10) that it was due to reopen February 17. Another nice spa was located elsewhere on the property, but one couldn't easily go back and forth between it and the pool. This property is a timeshare and so has free laundry facilities, badminton, croquet and volleyball available. The unit had a kitchen as well. I thought the $99 I paid for a living social deal was an okay deal, but my husband really disliked the place. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Jill Z
Reviews.Content: RiverPointe is by far, the place resort/hotel iv ever been to! I love the personal houses, and they really do have the "homey" feeling. I would go here whenever i could. :) Love it, Love it, Love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Imagination”
Reviews.Author: Sworbie
Reviews.Content: River pointe has been, by far, one of my favorite places to stay when I'm in Napa. It's a great location to everything- shopping centers, vineyards, river, etc. The staff is great and super friendly. Upon arrival, keys are given and directions on how to get to your room. If you've been here, it looks like a neighborhood of sweet cottages, when to be frank, it's a trailer park, but it does NOT feel or look that way at all. The room is pretty spacious. You have a living room, a couch that turns into a bed (if you have more than 2 people in your party) your own kitchen, a comfy bedroom, and a porch out in front. They also have 2 hot jacuzzi, a swimming pool, a club house and a lounge at the resort. In the morning, the housekeepers comes and changes out anything you need. If you feel something is missing, or the housekeepers couldn't provide, you can call front desk and they will help you. This place is reasonably priced, and by all means, affordable. My stay here has been pleasant, and whatever problems I had (once had a very noisy neighbor that blasted their music) I called front desk, and it was handled immediately. I would recommend everyone to stay here, or at least, let them judge it for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tennille T
Reviews.Content: Riverpointe is a great location if you want a relaxing, peaceful environment. Everything about this resort was calm, clean and cool. The 1bedrm was a nice size for two people. It was clean and peaceful. The area was serene with fresh air and beautiful scenary. More importantly the staff also made this a wonderful and relaxing experience with their great attitudes. Jerome and Mary work in housekeeping and did an excellent job with making our experience comfortable and rewarding. Good housekeeping staff always makes a difference! We will be back! Thank your Riverpointe for this great experience :) Thanks, Tennille and Rodney

Reviews.Title: “Too small for 4 people”
Reviews.Author: GetMeOuttaHere07076
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days with our friends on the pull out couch before booking a room nearby. Pull out was comfy. Trailer was clean as a whistle upon arrival but, maid service is only offered once during the week which is not enough for 4 people. When service is done they only pick up dirty towels, empty trash can, and drop off clean towels. It would be nice if they'd give the floors The one bedroom is great for a couple but, too small for 4. The only other issue is that the entire trailer rocks whenever anyone takes a step. Didn't check out pool or hot tubs because it's December.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiant little community, amazing value.”
Reviews.Author: minx1290
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning our October trip to Napa valley and wanted one of our best friends to come along. Unfortuantely, she was a little lacking in funds at the time and so we thought we would get a room with a pull out couch so she wouldn't have to spend on a hotel. To our horror, it seemed like everything in Napa that weekend was $400+ a night. And staying for 5 nights meant quite a bit of money on some mediocre hotels. So I began looking for temporary rentals and the sort and happened upon this place. It is a time share and if a person with a week cannot make that week, they are allowed to rent it out. We were lucky enough to get this place for 5 days for what it would have cost for 1 night at the lowest price hotel in town that weekend. We were not sure what to expect when the owner told us that they were "portable" units, but once we arrived we were very pleasantly surprized. This is a trailer community, but the community is a absolutely charming. All the units are either yellow, red, or blue and look more like little houses than trailers. All have the same little land scaped path of lawn in the front and parking spot driveway. All units also have a little patio with table and chairs before you walk into the unit itself. The units are very nicely outfitted. We were shocked to see the inside of a trailer could look so nice! high ceilings with windows around, a living room area with TV, radio, pull out couch, a dining table, and a full kitchen. the bathroom was also very nice and the bedroom was very comfortable. Of all the rooms, the bedroom was probably the smallest and the only room that felt a little cramped, but we had 2 dressers. 2 night stands, a tv and a queen bed in there and we tried to put all our luggage in as well. Right behind the trailer, and visible through the living room window is a trail that snakes right along side the Napa River. All in all, we were VERY pleasantly surprized by how nicely they could transform a trailer. In fact, we enjoyed our stay (and the price!) so much that we even asked the front desk if there were any time shares available . Unfortuantely there aren't, but we may go back here to try it again!

Reviews.Title: “the best place”
Reviews.Author: anthony h
Reviews.Content: it was a great expirience staying at riverpointe its a really nice place to relax and to be with the family..also EFRAIN L was really nice an patient all the times he had to came and help us we appriciate his help!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, good location”
Reviews.Author: mbeachjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early Oct. in a 1 bedroom. Lovely resort, very clean, yes mobile homes, perfect for 2 people. Nice patio area. We were given usefull information at the breakfast orientation on how to avoid the main highway and use the Silvarado Trail which was right around the corner. Very close to Oxbow market which was a great foodie place.The River Walk Trail was right behind the resort. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “From start (reservations) to finish (check-out,) EVERYTHING about RiverPointe Napa Valley Resort was AWESOME.”
Reviews.Author: bleedinorange78
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations for our stay at RiverPointe Napa Valley Resort with Dana. Dana was extremely pleasant and helpful. The check-in process was speedy and effecient, even though there was much commotion due to Halloween party attendees gathering in and around the front entrance and front reception areas. The property was well-manicured and clean. The room was great. Very clean, quiet, and private. Comfortable little living room/kitchen/dining area. Private patio, covered by a large tree was a nice place to sit when we returned from dinner with a nice glass of wine and an excellent place to enjoy our Sunday paper and coffee. The bed was very comfortable, with high-quality linens. Having travelled extensively, a comfortable bed with high-quality linens are a nice luxury when away from home. We were sad to leave as we were so enjoying our anniversary get-away so much. We will DEFINATELY stay here again and again and will recommend it to our family and friends. Thank you to Dana and everyone at Riverpointe Napa Valley Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet cozy location and best and friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Castle0
Reviews.Content: Awesome place and excellent customer service top notch staff

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great. You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: number5alive
Reviews.Content: RiverPointe Napa is a trailer park. Not that I have anything against trailer parks, but that is exactly what it is. If you are looking for a hotel or a real resort, this is not it. Pros: Clean, good location for wine touring, quiet, cheap. Cons: Maintenance issues (we had no hot water for the first 2 days), trailer-park feel If you want to come to Napa and spend your money on wine rather than on accommodations, then RiverPointe is the place to be. It is very inexpensive ($109/night through TripAdvisor) and it is clean. However, it is a trailer park and it does not have the things a regular hotel would have. It is in Napa, but you can't really walk to the main drag of Napa. It's more of a 5-minute drive. Worth it if you are trying to save money. We also had more than one maintenance issue during our stay. The most annoying one was that the gas tank went out on our trailer, leaving us with no hot water and no fire on the gas stove. The maintenance people were very fast, but it would have been nice if we didn't have to call them at all. Personally, I wouldn't stay here again, but I would recommend it for someone who really wants to save money and is looking for an adequate but not fancy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: rakada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The cottage was clean and comfortable. In the kitchenette you can prepare or warm up small snacks. The resort is quietly located outside of Napa city centre. If you want to use the breakfast vouchers (we booked breakfast vouchers in advance, and I don't understand why they charged us 12 Dollars for a 10 Dollar voucher) you have to go the three kilometers into downtown, they do not offer breakfast at the resort. You share the patio, using it makes fun when you travel with friends having the cottage next to you, or when the other cottage is not occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little cottages”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this resort and will be back again. The decks off the cottages were terrific for relaxing after a long day of travel. There was a BBQ grill and seating area very close to our cottage which we took advantage of one night and grilled up a terrific steak from the Oxbo (a great recommendation from the staff). The staff also recommended a fabulous little "hole in the wall" restaurant called the Red Rock (it was just a few miles from the resort). Their hospitality and the food was outstanding. If you go, you must try the Sweet Potato Fries with the maple syrup. YUM! Both my husband and I really loved the bedding at the resort and slept wonderfully. The sheets were soft and the bed was cozy, yet still cool and not over-heavy with blankets and comforters. We took advantage of the kitchen and all that came with it and cooked "at home" or grilled and we found that the kitchen was well stocked. One thing they could improve was the lighting (my hubby might disagree - I like to have lots of lights on at night and he prefers it dim). Overall I thought the place was very clean and comfortable and the location was fantastic. The staff had a lot of great recommedations and were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyK
Reviews.Content: James and staff were wonderful and very accommadating. The cottages were clean and cozy. This is a great place to stay and relax on your own deck with a cup of coffee in the morning or a nice glass of wine in the evening. The walkway along the river was beautiful. by far best place in Napa Valley to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Kyla B
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this resort! My girlfriends and I have come back three years in a row and plan on continuing our ladies trip annually! We have amazing customer service with all the staff, our room is always the perfect place to cook and have MORE wine after a fun day of tasting, and the pool/hot tub are always a hit! The furniture has recently been updated, and I love the comfortable, soft bed! Overall, the place is clean, cozy and perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Motel 6 room in a trailer”
Reviews.Author: FlCracker
Reviews.Content: So glad we only stayed one night. This was a big TA letdown. Where to start? The unit was not clean. Floors had dust/debris in various places, and the bathroom had hairs that were found in every corner from previous guests. I am fairly confident the indoor/outdoor carpet in the tiny bedroom was not swept, and I also wonder if the sheets had truly been changed - one stained pillowcase seemed especially suspect. I am guessing the unit had been more or less spot cleaned and most of the focus was on doing gimmicky things w/ towels and paper goods throughout the unit (as noted in previous reviews). Most electrical units seemed to not be functioning, so we ended up making coffee in the TINY bathroom. The overall feel of the 1br trailer was cheap and worn and cramped. Finally, the trailer was not level, so the entire unit tilted to the right. As we used it as a basic crash pad for a night, we slept in our clothes and kept our shoes on. While we didn't have the time/energy to raise a fuss about the conditions as they were discovered, the staff didn't seem interested in helping guests in general. I knew it was going to be a different type of accomodation, but never expected the cleanliness issues.

Reviews.Title: “For the casual, low maintance traveler”
Reviews.Author: mars2182
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in October 2011. We had 3 friends staying in a one bedroom room (double/ queen bed) and a pull out couch in the living room area. It was nice to have a door to the bedroom and a kitchen (full fridge, microwave, etc.) and a living room type space with a full couch, chair and coffee table. If you had 3 people that are uncomfortable sharing close quarters or changing clothes in front of others, this is not the place for you...or you need a two bed room. We spent most of our days at wine tastings so we didn't need a fancy place to sleep. I would recommend this place for the casual, low maintance traveler who doesn't require high end things to have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Chedderella
Reviews.Content: It was a blast to stay here at riverpoint. Frank was excellent in help and advice on where to go. Anything I needed he was able to help me with. Can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Week at Napa”
Reviews.Author: temkay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort Sept. 18-25th. We spent a nice week touring wineries, San Fran, Calastoga, Sonoma and Armstrong Redwood park. the Modular we were in was Small and not one on the nicest places we have stayed.CONS: the TV and wall outlets in the bedroom did not work. Small bed in bedroom and was not comfortable, Sofa in general room was old and VERY uncomfortable. The easy chair was on wheels and moved when you sat in it - plus your feet did not touch the floor. This was a useless piece of furniture. PROS: Other than our room, the resort was nice, clean with friendly staff. Our cleaner Maria was a Pro- she was nice, friendly and professional. The maintenance people Jerome and Alex were also nice, freindly and professional - since our modular had problems, we saw alot of them. Napa is a very nice place to visit, RiverPointe in will not be a place we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Napa, Tiny quarters”
Reviews.Author: cygnetgirl
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place per se, but very small quarters. Its good for two people that know each other really well or a family with one small child. Basically these are very cute mobile homes (single wide). Well appointed, well decorated, good beds (even the pull out was comfortable) and you have the necessities - bath, shower, stove, fridge, table, etc. Not much else, but great location. A little bit of a walk to downtown but totally do-able if you like walking. Not bad for the price during high-season in Napa (Fall crush).

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: Zoie4
Reviews.Content: love this place!!!!!! been here several times...the staff is so nice especially Frank in maintence...he helped us several times with our tv remote, air, and lights...he was prompt and so friendly.... what an asset he is to River Pointe.....the cottages are kept cleaned and love the wood floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, good value!”
Reviews.Author: 60795HappyCamper16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in RiverPointe while we were in Napa for a family wedding. It was great fun to have a number of units occupied by our friends and family. The units were clean and comfortable and very quaint. We shared a deck with another couple in our party so making plans at our common outdoor table while still in our pajamas felt comfortable. Everyone on the RiverPointe staff was friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfortable. The kitchen was well stocked with common conveniences. There are sliding doors in the unit making it easy to have a little privacy while others are in the living area. Go for an early morning walk around the property on the trail or take a relaxing soak in the hot tub after a day of wine tasting. You do need a vehicle to get around but the staff will be happy to give you directions. We visited nearby Calistoga and Yountville during our stay as well as downtown Napa. We also spent a few hours at the Premium Outlets when we needed to fill a few hours (some of our group just relaxed at the pool). RiverPointe is just the cutest place and I'd go back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the value at Riverpoint!”
Reviews.Author: basquefam
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Riverpoint. The first time was for a week thru a trade with Interval International, and most recently we stayed for the weekend - arrangements made thru Resortime. The location is perfect for all the wine tasting we enjoyed and for our very long list of restaurants we wanted to hit during our stay(s). The units are quaint, and in good shape. There is a nice pool and hot tub area, and a really nice 2 mile round trip walking path. Our favorite places to go when in the area is wine tasting at Vintner's Collective (superb small production wines offered here). We always have to go to Chateau St. Jean in Sonoma. The wines are always top-notch here too, and with a gorgeous view as a bonus! Our favorite restaurants are Mustards Grill, Bistro Jeanty, and Cook. Hard to choose - so many fantastic restaurants!! Napa/Sonoma are such fantastic destinations, but can be a very expensive getaway. Riverpoint is a terrific value - nice accommodations, great location, and gives you more money to spend on wine and food!!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for a wine-tasting adventure!”
Reviews.Author: Worldytravler
Reviews.Content: We reserved this resort through a timeshare exchange, and were very pleased with the results. Once you get past the fact that these are "mobile units" you quickly get used to the comforts of home in thse mini full suites. The place was one of the cleanest I've seen, and came fully outfitted with a kitchen including dishwasher, and cold, cold A/C. Plus a private deck (if you request) and view of the Napa river. Best of all, it was literally at the beginning of the Silverado Trail, and very close to downtown Napa. Finally, it had fluffy towels (moreso than some 5-star hotels I've stayed at) and a comfy bed. Great place to stay while in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess143
Reviews.Content: Definitely 5 stars!!! Riverpointe Resort is definitely at the top of our list. My husband surprised me with a trip to Napa for my birthday. The staff is wonderful, the grounds are beautiful, the room was so clean and tidy (well decorated too), I felt so at home. It was so peaceful and quiet at night. I had the best birthday ever, and went home well rested.The maintenance team is awesome! While working hard Jerome and Efrain stopped to say hello, and ask if everything was going well with our stay. I can't wait until our next trip to the Riverpointe Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service At Its Best”
Reviews.Author: BevYacovitch
Reviews.Content: Owning a timeshare for 30 years, I have made many trades in Mexico, all over the U.S. and Spain but never had a resort offer so much to its patrons and owners. Majority of all timeshares offer a wine and cheese or breakfast to introduce the week ahead for its visitors but many have strings attached like a Timeshare presentation. Not at Riverpointe, only a friendly introduction by General Manager Jim and then orientation activities director, Marilyn. Marilyn is well known across Napa Valley by restaurants, tour companies and wineries, they all love her! She will bend backwards for you to make reservations, give honest recommendations and get you discount rates. The one bedroom at the Riverpointe are 400 square feet mobile home on wheels...why you ask? Riverpointe is situated on the Napa River which floods and the mobile cottages can be rolled away. I have read so many negative comments over the rooms do them I say, "Get over yourself!" This is not a four star resorts because of the cottage but about the superior customer services, activity and beautiful landscaped property. If you want a five star resort that only offers beautiful rooms and high price restaurants don't book here but you will be doing yourself a favor. If you are visiting Napa Valley for the wineries and not your room, DO YOURSELF A FAVOR...trade or book nowhere else but Riverpointe.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: michel t
Reviews.Content: i really liked being at river pointe for vacationit made me feel like i was in my own house i recomend this resourt to other people because the maintance guy were really on track specially efrain lopez he was really helpfull and help with the water hiter...its a nice place to be with all the family and its also relaxing...being back is on my plans again!!

Reviews.Title: “By the Napa River -- so beautiful and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: AdSpotsWi-Fi
Reviews.Content: Frank rocks--he's the maintenance guy and Marilyn is the queen of wine tasting. The rooms are so nice and modern for a little cottage. Better than staying in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place - would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Smilea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon in July 2011, my Mum and Dad own a timeshare and kindly let us use it. We stayed here for 5 nights. My first impression of River Pointe was that it looks lovely - the 'rooms' are actually little cabins that look a bit like static caravans, but they are all different colours and look very cute! The cabin was spacious with a lounge area that included TV and coffee table, there is a separate area for a dining table, and a kitchenette with all the things you need to cook for yourself if you so wish. Our bedroom was small but had a nice big comfy bed with another TV and a wardrobe for your clothes. When we arrived, the Maid had made 2 little elephants with the towels which were sat on our bed, it was a nice touch which would delight children! The bathroom was very clean, well stocked with towels and little toiletries and the shower was nice and hot! The pool was great - we spent a nice afternoon there, it was plaesant, clean and spacious. There is alos a gym, and a few Barbeque facilities around the property if you fancy cooking! The only thing that could maybe be classed as a downside was that when we opened our Welcome Pack, there was a section in it that explained that River Pointe was obligated to advise us that there is a 'chemical' present in the Napa Valley region that is 'known by the government to cause birth defects and cancer' !! As you can imagine, this was a little off-putting, but of course it isn't the hotel's fault! Another downside is that you have to pay an $8 per day charge for the amenities on site such as washing etc, this is mandatory even if you don't use the amenities. On the plus side, Wi-Fi is free which is good, as many other hotels do charge for this. Overall, I would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting a rejuvenating, relaxing stay. The sleepy downtown area of Napa is only a short drive away and has a host of nice little family-run restaurants and cute shops. If you want hustle and bustle, San Francisco is only about an hour's drive away!

Reviews.Title: “Trailers that work!”
Reviews.Author: czbozo
Reviews.Content: If you want fancy, this is not it. The trailers are clean and refurbished . We didn't get an adjoining patio deck as requested but we got a deck. Our view was the meadow. The property is on the Napa River Trail which is a one-mile trail connecting Lincoln and Trancas. We had a kitchnette complete with a 2-burner stove, microvwave, dishes, utensils and dishwasher. The complex has a pool and jacuzzi. My stay would have been perfect had there been hot water. I tried running the hot water in the shower but it never even reached warm. Our friends said they had hot water so maybe just our tank. Another thing, don't even ask for a late check out (11am) - it will cost you. For a one night stay, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this place to all my friends!”
Reviews.Author: dizzylizmom
Reviews.Content: We had read good and bad reviews of RiverPointe and after staying, can't find anything to complain about or be disappointed in. The units were adorable and quite comfy, though I do agree with lots of reviews mentioning that it would have been quite a tight fit for more than two people. We used the pool, hot-tub, grill areas and did a couple of the trips they arrange. Had a great time!! The staff was awesome from the word go. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Angels to the Rescue”
Reviews.Author: hummingbird1213
Reviews.Content: I am a co-owner of a week per year at RiverPointe. This is only the second time we have used our week for other then exchange. Of course it was a wonderful week for me and one of my girlfriends. The weather was great. I was especially excited to find that the lovely concierge, Marilyn, has been able to charm some of the wonderful wineries in to doing three complimentary wine tasting over the course of the week. Nice touch Marilyn. All of the staff was really wonderful when we needed help, with directions or just things right before our eyes that we could not see. There were two wonderful gentlemen on the staff who, smiled and greeted us upon our arrival that we had no idea initially how helpful they would be. Our first middle aged women in distress moment was when we could not figure out how to turn on the cable tv. We called the front desk and with in minutes Frank Guevara came to our rescue. He found simply, what we could not after a half an hour of trying, that the cleaning person had pushed the cable box behind the television. Oops. But the big rescue mission that both Frank Guevara and his Manager, Jerome Thomas, participated in was when we had driven 60 miles back from Lake County, to find our oil cap had been mistakenly left off. The car had started having a little trouble a couple of miles before we returned to RiverPointe. As we drove through the grounds, Jerome and Frank notice not only the strange noise coming from our car, but that it seemed to be leaking oil. If not for Frank and Jerome pointing this out to us and Frank going to the hardware store to purchase a new oir cap and oil for us, who knows what might have happened to us. He put the oil in, the cap on and advised us to let the car sit for awhile before departing. Thank you so much to the Riverpointe staff for making our trip so wonderful. And a special thanks to Frank and Jerome for coming to our rescue. Sincerely, Natalie Wesley

Reviews.Title: “Cozy peace and quiet...but VERY hard bed~!”
Reviews.Author: Xingdelancey1234
Reviews.Content: We took off to Napa with a tempered expectation of Riverpointe; however, we were VERY surprised and pleased with the quality of the resort and with the cottage we stayed in. This little gem made accessing the wine region completely simple. Clean, affordable and with full amenities and a great staff, we enjoyed our stay in quiet and peaceful calm. Friendly service and a beautiful setting for these cottages made it feel like a world away from the hustle of the city that's just beyond its borders. No charge for laundry service--it was not inside our cottage--included free soap and dryer sheets. Maid service was exceptionally detailed --she arranged my strewn luggage and tidied the entire place--and staff was more than helpful and friendly. We loved the high ceilings inside the cottage because they gave a feeling of much more room than we had anticipated. The additional picture windows in the room (above standard wall level) gave a feeling of airiness to the inside of the room. This little place was absolutely charming~! We used our small propane bbq on the deck and relaxed outside under the shade of the trees while watching hummingbirds float around the yard. The pool area is peaceful, very clean and offered umbrella covered tables. Meticulous landscaping around every cottage sets off the white lattice and highlights the design and color hues of the different cottages. Downsides: the double doors to the room are a little difficult to lock and the resort asks for a release of responsibility for personal items upon checking in. (Our maid failed to lock ours appropriately after servicing the room; however, nothing was missing and we were relieved.) We reported it for repairs, but found out that it's apparently an issue for all units. We locked our electronics in our vehicle when we left for day trips. (It probably would have been a non-issue for our us had we taken our laptop locking cables.) Another downside: the bed was way too firm for me; I compensated by sleeping on top of the down comforter. One more: internet service was terrible--no speed and couldn't access websites reliably; however, not a main issue for us since we didn't visit Napa to be on the net. An upside was soft water that tasted great~! We'll stay again because we enjoyed making it our cozy private space away from the hub of San Francisco and because all the wineries are a few moments away. Great bargain and very sufficient for our enjoyment. This little place is a great value and jumping point for so many wonderful places to see in the region~! I recommend at least a full one bedroom cottage for two, as I understood from another couple staying during our week that they didn't have room to store luggage in their room due to the fact that it was a 'half cottage'.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip...”
Reviews.Author: roadcall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the California wine country and couldn't have found a more convenient place to nest. The accommodations are separate bungalows (converted large mobile homes) that provide privacy, all needed comforts and the feeling that you're in a home and not in a room. The hotel area is beautiful, and very accessible to all the wineries and attractions that Napa has to offer. There are plenty of fine restaurants, including one (Compadres) across the street and right on the river. The hotel staff was very helpful in pointing out places to go and helping with directions. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: nanarn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to a trip to SF, 3 adult ladies,Friday thro Monday. We booked this online with a great price. The "cabins" were super cute, but for more than 3 adults it would have been tight. Nice to have a kitchen, and refrig, for saving a little money on some meals. Convienent to main highways, Oxbow market, Wally world and downtown. Were never hassled about the time share aspect of this place. Pool clean and well maintained, tho the hot tub we used was almost too warm. Bed comfy, but the pull out for more than one person would have been uncomfortable. Bathroom almost bigger than the bedroom. Enjoyed the walking path along the river. Seemed to be quite full when we were there, but not alot of noise factor, even with the shared patio. Laundry that was free was a bonus for packing purposes. Saw alot of families using the Barbq grills at nite. There seemed to be alot of them spread thro-out the property. We were surprized that there were no housekeeping services on the weekend. Not an issue really for us, but just unusual. Would we stay here again, Absolutely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: pblancha
Reviews.Content: We approached this with a little trepidation. Cabins were imacculate, neighbors were great - newlyweds. Very convenient location to both Napa Sonoma and San Francisco Service was great. Marilyn is a pistol We traded a 2 berm in Kauai for this, and you know what, we would do it again

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are comfortable and well kept”
Reviews.Author: tucker86_11
Reviews.Content: I am currently from Napa but joined the Army. I came to visit and got a great rate at the RiverPointe Resort. The service was out standing and the rooms were very well kept. The grounds were nice and updated and I couldn't of been happier. Can not wait to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great environment, green and beatiful.”
Reviews.Author: Hhlive2ski
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal. The little cabins that you have are super cute and you have your own patio with chairs and a table. Every day they have events planned that you can join in on or not. The wine tasting in the evenings are like wine classes-you will learn a lot. Bring a bike a ride into town or up the river trail which runs next to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: MsHoney0718
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at RiverPoint many times. We like the layout, the staff,the location. James, Marilyn, Jerome, & Dana are all so sweet and helpful. This is my first choice of places to stay when planning a weekend getaway. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Convenient....”
Reviews.Author: goneagain2009
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 days at Riverpointe. I traded my timeshare through Interval International to stay here. First I would like to say that the location is excellent and extraordinarily easy access to the Silverado Trail and the main highway through all of the towns (I can't recall the highway #). The unit was very clean and well stocked with towels, sheets etc. I spent part of the time solo and then had a couple of days with family and a couple of days with a friend. All seemed to like it. Housekeeping was friendly and for the most part, on top of things. The front desk did keep calling to try and meet with me to "plan my week". My week was planned before I ever got there and I told them that but it did take a few days for them to stop calling. Unfortunately, I did need to do some work while I was there and their wi-fi was no existent. Hopefully this is fixed by now, Comcast was supposed to be installing the week that I was there. I spent a great deal of time at Starbucks so that was really annoying because I did call to verify that they had wi-fi and was assured that they did. The decks on the units are not private which I really didn't like. So if I wanted to sit on the deck and my neighbors wanted to be there too, you would have to share. Overall, a cute place and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Indescribable feeling”
Reviews.Author: TianaBlackDean
Reviews.Content: me and my husband actually visited River Pointe twice already, and we are so ready to come back!!! those were my first times ever feeling so relaxed and so fresh. the environment was lovely. There is also a delicious restaurant across the street name Compadres, and the food....GREAT! The customer service was awesome!. Jerome and Jennifer made me and my husband feel so at home and i would rate they service skills...2 thumbs up!!! They made sure that our room was comfortable and they made us come back. overall we had an amazing stay at river pointe and i would definitely recommend this resort not just to couples but to families as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cosy in good location”
Reviews.Author: beansfc
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my partner and another couple to Napa Valley and thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay (1 night) at the River Point Resort. For the price we knew it was not going to be a huge room with every luxury but it was one of the only accommodations who would allow a 1 night stay which we required. The cabin was clean and tidy and perfect for our requirements, which was basically just a place to rest our heads after a day of wine tasting. It was pretty small but again this was fine for us. I think if a family were to stay it might be a little small to be in one of the cottages/cabins as the fold out sofa does take up alot of space. All in all we were very pleased with the accommodation and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could have asked for”
Reviews.Author: fairoaksgidget
Reviews.Content: Our stay was just great. The staff was very helpful and the accomendations were very clean. The little individual rooms made you feel like your were in your own home with everything you would need surrounded with a pretty garden area and access to a great river walk way to go on and explore. Everything was clean!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, quiet, and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: expelliarmus22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were visiting Napa for the first time. We really wanted to stay somewhere close enough to the restaurants and wineries, while still escaping city noises. We found this place to be quite the fit! The location was close to everything we were planning to visit. Even though it was so close to the city, it seemed like were were secluded due to the lush trees and greenary surrounding the place. I loved having the privacy of our own cottage with a cute porch we can relax on while enjoying the beautiful peacefulness of being outside. The service was great. We were especially impressed by Jennifer, we believe she is the Assistant General Manager. She was so friendly and welcoming at the Monday morning breakfast. We were only disappointed that we could not stay longer but we definitely plan to stay here next time we are in Napa. If you are looking for a cute, welcoming, and quiet place I would definitely recommend Riverpointe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trailers a bit small/cheesy”
Reviews.Author: casaredman
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. We traded our timeshare (Interval) and this was the only location available. The staff, activities were great. Marilyn's, our hostess, is a hoot - you'll love her. She gave us great advice. I was happy that she had strong opinions on where to go, how to get there, where not to go, etc.... Beware they charge you a $8/day surcharge. I've never been to a resort that did this. The trailers were small but clean. Everything worked fine. It was just my wife and I in the large one-bedroom unit and we found it small. I can't imagine more people (i.e. pull-out sofa sleeper). Washer/dryer's are not in the units, but located in back of the property (free of charge). On the down side, our trailer was located on a street with no street lamps. One night it was pitch black and my wife fell navigating to the porch. That was our first night - - thereafter, we left our porch light on. We notified the manager and he indicated people complained when that had area lighting - - seems odd. Wi-Fi was a bit sporatic, but free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest!”
Reviews.Author: marciopin
Reviews.Content: Best place to rest and enjoy. We love the place and the calm enviroment. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Little "Single-Wide."”
Reviews.Author: Chateauneuf
Reviews.Content: We knew we were going to be staying in a "mobile home," but were delighted to find out how charming and comfortable the units were and how lovely the riverside location was . Even more impressive was the delightful concierge, Marilyn, and the many activities she had planned and the great food she prepared for complimentary breakfasts and wine-food pairings. We would return again just to experience her hospitality, her right-on advice about wineries and dining options, and her great personality. The location was convenient to all venues in the valley, and the riverfront walking trail was an unexpected delight that helped us counter the effect of great wine and food. Certainly, this is no "Auberge de Soleil," but in terms of pleasure, convenience and comfort, it certainly can give it a run for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Opening the bottle starts here”
Reviews.Author: Golf777
Reviews.Content: Visited Napa for a couple of nights with my wife for some wine tasting. Riverpoint resort was highly recommended. The staff was fanastic and very helpful with finding the perfect restaurant and winery. The rooms are so cozy, it makes a long day of wine tasting that much better when you have a beautiful resort to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: burningrivergirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Riverpoint in September for a week for our honeymoon. We knew ahead of time that the apartments were moveable units and it ended up being a non-issue. Our unit was clean and well equipped. We enjoyed using the patio, cooking in the unit, using the grills on the grounds and walking along the river path. All of the staff was very nice and housekeeping was fine. The location of the condo was also great. We were a short drive to downtown Napa, restaurants, Trader Joes, Target, Rinny Regos, Whole Foods and Walmart. The condo was also right off the silverado trail and the main highway which allowed easy drives to all of the wineries. Overall, we had an awesome honeymoon and relaxing stay at Riverpointe!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay alongside the Napa River”
Reviews.Author: signora2
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at Riverpointe using a timeshare exchange. We were aware that the facilities were movable trailers but we were so pleasantly surprised to find them quite comfortable and the entire atmosphere of the resort very delightful. We had a one bedroom trailer (#50) that had it own small deck. Many units share the deck area. We were close to the clubhouse so we had good wifi for our netbook, but the server was slow at times of peak use. The unit had a queen size bed in the bedroom and the living area was spacious. We enjoyed the pool, the hot tub and walking along the 1.2 mile trail alongside the river. The resort offered a number of activities each day...some free and some at a fee. We enjoyed three free wine tastings at the resort...two even had munchies to go along with the wine. We attended the free full breakfast orientation on the Monday morning. There were various tour options that many participated in that were organized by the concierge, Marilyn, at a reasonable fee. There is a minimal fitness center with no weights so rather than use it, we walked the river trail. We definitely would recommend the resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely different but surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: a1000monkeys
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a great rate for labor day weekend on hotels.com. I was a bit weary due to the fact that the resort is technically a trailer park right down the street from WalMart but once we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. We had a one bedroom unit. It's very cozy with a small kitchen/living room, bath and separate bedroom. It was very clean and well stocked. The bed was probably one of the most comfortable I have stayed in at any resort. However, the room was so small that the king size bed took up most of the space. I believe these units can accomodate four since there is a pull out sofa in the living room but it would really be too small for four adults. If it were raining I probably would have feld claustrophobic inside. Fortunately the weather was perfect so I sat outside on the patio which we shared with the neighboring unit. Fortunately we had great neighbors and it was fun to swap winery recommendations. The grounds were very well maintained and the pools and spas perfect. It's located right on the bike trail and I wished we had brought our bikes. The resort is very family friendly and almost had the feel of an upscale camp ground. In any event, it was way better than a motel and was comparably priced. We would definitely return to Riverpointe during the summer again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: TheNewPlaid
Reviews.Content: The pool and hot tub were beautiful, the rooms are trailers that are very nicely appointed and the staff was helpful and not overly pushy with the timeshare presentations. The hide-a-bed was the most comfortable we've slept on and the bed was as comfortable as they get. Across the street is a restaurant with an excellent $20 ribeye. We stayed in a one bedroom with another couple and it was cozy but wasn't too small for the four of us. That said, a two bedroom would have been a little more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be surprised....”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMH
Reviews.Content: Just a head's up for potential guests; Upon arrival you will be informed of a $5 per night service charge in over and above t your agreed upon rate. If you are there for the weekend, please be advised that you will not receive maid service either!! If you you can overlook this unethical behavior, it's an excellent place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Napa NIGHTMARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RichBit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend and can't wait to leave!! Hot tub outta order so tried to take a hot bath, well even then bath won't hold water. Had the maintance enter our room even though I posted the DO NOT Disturb sign on the door!! The pool at the club house, well let's just say it would have been more sanitary to just go for a dip in the river!! Although the location in nice and the setting was pretty, loved bbqing, I would never stay here again nor recomend this place to any soul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rfretz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riverpointe for Memorial Weekend as a kind of joint birthday for my boyfriend and I and it was perfect... the resort is close to downtown Napa, so there was lots to do and it wasn't much of a drive to St. Helena and Yountsville. The resort was quiet and welcoming, the units are very clean and the grounds are very well maintained. (and the beds are super comfortable, hated to get up in the mornings!!!) A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute Trailers Suite”
Reviews.Author: ningen
Reviews.Content: We arrived really late at night and make it in time before the reception is closed. We quickly check out our room / suite and it was very welcoming with the nice kitchen and living room and a bedroom. Everything is spotlessly clean and it was so new it has that newly constructed scent. One thing we have to know here is that its not a 5 star Mandarin Hotel or W or Ritz Carlton. But it definately has good service and the employees make sure that the guests of the hotel have a comfortable stay. We were lucky to have the BBQ stove behind our unit and theres 2 pool we can use. We went around for wine tasting the whole day, walk along the river at the back of the hotel and have a great BBQ dinner. It was really romantic because of the way the rooms are layout, they are somewhat private. Internet is free in the clubhouse and everything else is within 5 minutes driving distance. We will definately check back to the hotel if we visit napa the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good place - skip the California Vacation Club”
Reviews.Author: CWoodford
Reviews.Content: Nice place and layout suits well to share with another couple. Very clean - showing its age a little - but comfortable bed and layout. Easy to have breakfast on patio. Nice staff. They do a nice job of welcoming groups and some wine introduction. This is a timeshare but they don't pressure for that. The California Vacation Club is another story. While promising "no pressure" the first level sales guy was very pleasant. However, once you say NO, the pressure and very rude manager steps in. Skip it as the the gifts not really worth it Castello D'Amorosino is a misplaced attempt to recreate an Italian Castle. The only thing they forgot was good wines and the Italian "way". Otherwise, River Pointe experience was great. Also close enough to make a day trip into SF (free wireless but it was quite slow)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay...despite it being in a trailer.”
Reviews.Author: basketlady88
Reviews.Content: We're returning in a week for our 3rd trip to RiverPointe. We've traded a week of timeshare to do this and while I wish there were other places to stay....we've been pleased so far. We visit with friends and it's nice that the 2nd bedroom is in another trailer (across the deck). It's a VERY convient location and we enjoy the pool and hottub after a long day in the vineyards. My sole wish....free internet in the trailers.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, situation and vacation in Napa”
Reviews.Author: CapnCohen
Reviews.Content: First, a little background: we are a family of four (kids are 13 and 10) from a quite suburban/rural area. We have all vacationed in everything from a fancy downtown Chicago suite to a rainy Virginia campsite. We like the finer things life has to offer, and we get picky when stuff doesn't work right. Our stay at the Riverpointe could not have worked out much better than we had hoped. First, it's true that the units are, essentially, mobile homes. Ours had a small living room (double size sleeper sofa), a full kitchen, bathroom and bedroom with a king bed. Central air and ceiling fans. Everything worked well (the Wi-fi had to be rebooted twice, though the staff did that quickly). Attached to the unit was a 10 x 8 patio with table, umbrella and chairs. For a family with up to two young children, this was a clean, well-maintained and comfortable place to sleep and decompress after touring the wine country and northern bay area. Second, the staff went above and beyond the call of duty. They researched and printed out San Francisco ferry schedules, held free wine tastings, organized a free breakfast with raffle (we won a river cruise at 50% off) and no timeshare talk, coordinated wine tours (though we went off on our own), removed a drainpipe to look for a lost baby tooth, and helped fix a broken roll-away case. Third, Riverpointe's location is optimal. It's just about at the southern junction of Route 29 and Silverado trail, the two main arteries through Napa Valley. Need supplies for the kitchen or travel? Wal-Mart is 1/10 mile away. Want fresh and environmentally sound fish, meat, produce, cheese and gourmet items? Ox Bow Market is five minutes away. Restaurants? Fast food, sit-down chains, upscale and delicious holes-in-the-wall are throughout Napa (hint: ask about Rancho Grande, a three-minute drive). It took us about 45 minutes to get to Santa Rosa (Charles Schultz Museum), 50 minutes to drive to Sausalito, 70 to Fisherman's Wharf, and approximately 90 to reach Bodega Bay. We didn't taste Sonoma on this trip, but it's closer than Santa Rosa. Fourth, the common-area amenities include two hot tubs, heated pool, laundry facilities (no coins necessary) gas grills, computer with free Web access, Wii games and a pool table. In conclusion, this is not your place if you: have a large family, and your family don't travel well together, like to hang out for long periods in your room, require pampering and luxurious amenities. If we visit the wine country again, we would make Riverpointe our first choice for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Very well kept trailer park with great staff in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: obeez
Reviews.Content: If I had just showed up and not researched this resort I probably would've been surprised and somewhat disappointed. I had done my homework and knew what to expect. They are mobile units and it is somewhat like a very well kept trailer park. Went with wife and another couple and found the lodging to be adequate and service of the resort personell to be exceptional. Nice pool and two hot tubs on site. Had two adjoining units, one full size and one was 1/2 of another trailer joined with a shared deck in between the two units. Used the deck to sit around and relax at night and get together in the mornings to plan our day. Ideal location in regards to proximity to Napa and Sonoma as well as San Fran, Oakland and other tourist destinations. One caveat to resort, they advertise the units to accomodate 6 if you get the two units. I think 1 couple per unit is the max. Young kids on the sleeper sofa, maybe, but not two full grown adults. Recommend Red Rock Cafe for ribs and barbeque and ButterCream bakery for breakfast. Both right down the street from resort. Be sure to check in by 11PM or may be no one on duty at resort. Many of Sonoma's wineries offer free tastings and the ones that do charge are still less expensive than Napa. Both offer some great wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Active Vistor to Napa”
Reviews.Author: Ephman85
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't want to spent 24/7 in the unit, but we didn't travel across the country to Napa to hang out in a hotel. Yes, they're mobile units, "trailers" if you must, but if you can get over that (and obviously, some can't), you can base a great vacation out of RiverPointe. The grounds are immaculate and the unit had everything we needed (kitchen, full-size fridge, etc.), certainly more than the average hotel room. Location is very handy to the Silverado Trail, but is crosstown from Hwy 29. Overall, pretty easy to navigate. Top scores on Value because we traded in our timeshare week through Interval International. Essentially, one week here cost us the same as two nights would have elsewhere in the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “It is a trailer park”
Reviews.Author: UserID
Reviews.Content: This is a trailer park. We traveled here believing we would be staying in a quaint timeshare resort in Napa, and we ended up in a trailer park. This "resort," if one can refer to it as such, is not at all as it is marketed. We truly stayed in a trailer with a hitch in the front, metal steps leading up to the door, and a camper-like shower.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical timeshare, but really nice!”
Reviews.Author: car_and_scott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at River Pointe from July 31-August 7. I had read trip advisor before booking and was aware of the fact that it is a trailer park, the units make noise when you walk through them, and the amenities were not as nice when comparing them to other timeshares. However, we were really pleased with the resort and had a great stay! We were impressed with how nice everyone was that worked there. We even did the sales pitch, which was interesting and I guess worth the free things they offer. We really used the resort as a base camp for activities throughout the region, traveling into San Francisco (about an hour) and of course all through wine country. Some days we left at 8am and didn't return until well after midnight! The cottage was absolutely spotless and had everything we wanted. For two people, the one bedroom is slightly cramped when getting ready in the bathroom/bedroom. I can't imagine if you had 4 people in there - way too small. A feature we loved was that they will ship your wine for you. All we had to do was fill out some paperwork and left our wine with them, and they took care of the rest using a local shipping company. So easy! We also had wireless access in the cottage free of charge. Not sure if this is throughout the entire resort, but we used the internet all week on our own laptop! I got the impression there was a charge for wireless...maybe that has changed. Overall, we had a great stay. I think if people are aware of exactly what type of place it is, you are much better prepared once you arrive. I think if I was unaware of some of the quirks, I would have not been as pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea!”
Reviews.Author: mmb1776
Reviews.Content: I traded into this "resort" from a Marriott timeshare banked through Interval International. I was told it was a "5 star" resort. I accepted it before I did any research on the resort. I did check Trip Advisor before I left so I was prepared for the fact it is basically a trailer park but I didn't tell my husband until we were just turning in. He was floored! The resort is fine if all you do there is sleep. Comfort-wise it was just okay. I couldn't shake the feeling of being in a Winnebago all week! We camped with a trailer years ago and it felt essentially the same except there was a bathtub and not just a shower in this one! To be fair, the unit was clean, there is a lot of storage space but I'm a bit of a princess, I guess. I like more upscale accommodations! I didn't see any playground equipment for children so other than the pool, there's not much for young children or teens. I had to wait in line to do laundry. For 106 trailers, er, excuse me, "cottages", there are only 3 washers and 3 dryers and it took forever to dry a load of clothes! I didn't think the neighborhood was exceptionally nice. When you think of a resort in Napa, you think of something other than what you'll find here! Upon checking in we were invited to an "informational" meeting on the Monday morning of our visit...translation: time share meeting, although we were told that this resort was "sold out!" Good thing, but we didn't want to waste our time hearing about anything this company had to offer. I know this is going to come off "snooty" and I don't mean it to...it's just that it's not my cup of tea! I'm used to Marriott timeshares and they are nothing like this little trailer park on a not particularly pretty part of the Napa River!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected but served it's purpose.”
Reviews.Author: scuttlebuttin
Reviews.Content: After spending time in time shares in Hawaii and Central California I expected much more than is provided at River Pointe. Although the units are ok, they are on par with a Super 8. Our unit had ants all over the bathroom and staff was notified. When we returned from the wineries that day there were more than before, used a "natural" bug spray - did nothing to kill or drive them away. We were told we could move to a different unit - if we did so in the next 15 minutes!! We did it. And we ended up in a trailer fitted for handicapped persons. The unit had about half the storage of our first unit and the shower was not suitable to stand in. I was livid at this point and my wife intervened. We were then given our third unit in two days/2 hours! The rest of our stay was standard. The towels are changed twice a week (every day at Super 8) and our last unit was very clean. Harkening back to Hawaii and Central Cali, there is no privacy on any deck. For a time share swap this was a sub-standard move. The pool was ok but the hot tubs need cleaned daily, like the grounds. There is a laptop computer for guest use where the other places I have stayed have 2 or more computers for guests. Activities were cancelled without notification. River Pointe is very well situated for winery visits and it is quiet at night. A lot would need to be done before I would stay there again and I will not recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: winnifred020
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for touring the wine country. The grounds were very well kept and the units were clean. True, it's a mobile unit, but we found ours to be spotless with a good-sized and functional kitchen, one bedroom and a decent sized living room area. Lots of storage. There is a walking/running trail on the grounds that was perfect (and keeps you off the streets). Gas grills are available scattered around the grounds and are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. All the grills were Weber, were clean and were functional. All-in-all a great place, especially in terms of location, value and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Retreat with eldest daughter”
Reviews.Author: skijumper
Reviews.Content: We booked the stay through a friend who was familiar with the property. We checked it out on line. We were expecting cottages but instead found mobile units on a fixed pad. It was well landscaped and very tidy. The units were very clean and comfortable, a bit small but adequate and the staff was great. There was a trail just outside our unit we enjoyed each morning that followed the Napa River. It was great for walking and exercising. Pool was clean and enjoyable and the laundry facility was free. The location was very convenient to local restaurants (wonderful food) and a good home base for the wine country tours. The neighbors had loud music Saturday afternoon but it stopped at sundown. Overall our experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for what they are”
Reviews.Author: GHB2
Reviews.Content: We just stayed a week and enjoyed the trip. The units are on wheels like everyone has mentioned. Inside they are very clean and nice with everything you need except a regular oven, but the units are also very small. What is considered to hold four people I wouldnâ€™t put more than two people in. We had a 2 bedroom unit which like others have mentioned are connected by the patio which was nice. But you need a two bedroom for 4 people. The pool was good, not great. The Jacuzzi by the pool could have been cleaner. But there was another by our unit which was much bigger and cleaner. The gym if you want to call it that was a very small room with a few pieces of equipment. Put 3 people in the room and itâ€™s crowded. So we walked everyday instead. The grounds are kept up very well. There is a decent Mexican food restaurant across the street and Wal Mart about a block away within walking distance. The river walk which goes for about 2.4 mile round trip was great. You are less than a mile away from the first winery for tasting and that is the start of the Silverado trail. Overall this was a very good stay and we would do it again. The location was perfect. We traded a lock-off unit (studio) for a 2 bedroom unit so I was pleased with the trade. If we had to trade a 2 for a 2 we wouldnâ€™t have been so pleased. It wouldnâ€™t have been a fair trade to me. So thatâ€™s something to keep in mind. But we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time to go- quite and no lines so you get the most for your money”
Reviews.Author: ncbldr
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Napa. This resort is very small but in a great location. We had the opportunity to visit about six winery s per day because there were no lines like in the summer months. We picked our 12 favorite wines we cannot get at home and brought them back with us. The resort itself was great in that they came 3 times to change towels and clean etc. The staff was fantastic and always willing to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: sweetta557
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying in a timeshare that my aunt was nice to give us as a wedding present in what on a map seemed just north of Sonoma Valley when it was actually a 2 hour ride. We decided to cut our looses and head down to Napa to see what we could find for accomidations last minute durring crush season. The chamber of commerce worker ( who by the way went above and beyond to help us save our honeymoon) suggested we check them out. We did and for about 100 a night it was perfect. It was right in down town Napa. The hotel included coupons for some local establishments and had trips through the hotel. We did a wine tour for about 80 dollars a head but it was great! and the price is average for Napa tours. We also did a free wine tasting at the hotel. The winemaker that gave the tasting invited anyone to his vinyard the next day for a free back stage tour! It was great and you can't beat free!!! Great place I hope to stay there again next time I am in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “A great camping experience”
Reviews.Author: SCalGal
Reviews.Content: I read every review on this property before booking through our timeshare. It was a "free" week so we decided to book the week of Thanksgiving. What has not been mentioned is that it is not a mobile home, it truly is a trailer, a fifth wheel (with wheels). The first time I sat on the couch inside the small living area, my daughter sat on the bed in the bedroom. I said, "earthquake". Being a Southern Californian, we are used to the feeling. "no, mom, it's just me...look" - each movement moves the unit. Probably the unique thing to this unit "43" was that it was directly across from the clubhouse. The lights blared through the bedroom windows all night. It felt like we had a 30 watt bulb on in the room. I requested a room change, but it was sold out as half of the units were moved off the properties for the winter. There were only 30 units left to rent. The other thing never written was the indoor/outdoor carpet in the bedroom was pretty gross. Probably cleaned several 100 times. It made your socks black and felt like rubber. The bathroom smelled of mold. There is no heater only a portable radiating heat unit. This was interesting when the kids were in the living area on the pull-out couch and we were in the bedroom. The doors had to stay open to have any heat. One of these things would have been okay, but overall not worthy of even 3 stars, maybe 2 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “A little misleading....”
Reviews.Author: jpug2002
Reviews.Content: We were under the impression we were going to be staying in a little cottage in Napa, but instead we discovered that the so-called cottage was actually a trailer! We checked out the website and the pictures are indeed very creatively shot so as to give one the impression a little bungalow was awaiting them...alas, that is not the case. Now, I'm not going to be completely negative in this review. For a trailer, the accomodations were satisfactory. It was clean and fairly new, and although the kitchenette was functional, there wasn't an actual oven, so a convection oven had to suffice. The location is ideal, and once the mobile home shock goes away, you find you assimilate fairly well. We made the best of it, and rest assured, many a joke was made at the poor trailer's expense. Overall, though, it made for quite the memory in an already memory-filled vacation. Oh, and lastly, the staff is pretty good there--two women by the names of Marilyn (the activity director) and Dana (front desk) were particularly helpful to us. Be sure to attend the 9AM Monday activities breakfast if you can, as it'll help you plan out your time in Napa which is great destination for sure!

Reviews.Title: “River Pointe”
Reviews.Author: Barry&Pat
Reviews.Content: Although this is a trailor park this all aded to the charm. This site is in a flood area so the trailors have tp be moved when the river overfows. This is why it is a trailor park. The accommodation was of a good size. You didnt feel like you were in a trailor except for slight movement when someone walked inside. Ther e was ample storage and the kitchen was very well equipped but there was only a microwave. The only criticisms we had was that the sofabed was not very comfortable and the upper windows did not have blinds on them. My daughter slept on the sofabed so was woken early by all the light flooding through the high windows. Also the river walk could be a litte noisy with the early morning walkers if your trailor backed onto the walkway.. The staff were very helpful with booking restaurants and excursions. There were several evening wine tastings which were very pleasant held in the dining room. There was a laundry which came in very handy. This was free to use. Wash powder and dryer sheets were free from receprion. There is an excess of $5 a day for a service charge. The pool area and hot tubs were of a good size and towels were available. There was also plenty of BBQs around the site for anyone to use. These were cleaned after use by the maintainance service.

Reviews.Title: “It's a trailer park!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Needless to say, we were disappointed that we were staying at a trailer park. It is not advertised as such with Interval International. Our understanding was that we would be staying in a 2 bedroom condo. It was not that at all. We were in a small one bedroom trailer and our guests were in a smaller one bedroom studio trailer. How embarrassing. The only place to accommodate all four in the party was to sit on the metal deck which connected the two trailers. We often smelled propane gas outside the unit. We had to take turns making and eating breakfast as there was not enough room in the kitchen or chairs at the table. As you walked through the trailer you could feel the movement of the floor. Getting around the bed was another challenge - you had to take turns. Parking provided another problem - if you didn't angle your car you would run into the trailer hitch. At the end of the week, I think we agreed that River Pointe's location was all it had going for it.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Riverpointe”
Reviews.Author: maribethb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week in Napa Valley at Riverpoint. While they were trailers, they were very comfortable and had great amentites. We enjoyed sitting on the deck at night with a bottle of wine overlooking the river, watching people walk by with their dogs on the trail. My Dad ran on the trail every morning and loved it. The only oven was a convection oven, but when we inquired at the front desk about how to cook a Papa Murphy's pizza, they said we could use the oven in the club house which we did. Great solution. That is a good example of how friendly the staff is. They also helped us ship our wine home for a reasonable fee (we checked around town for shipping prices). Definitely go to the Monday morning breakfast. Besides being a free breakfast with treats from the Buttercream Bakery (yum), they gave out lots of coupons and maps and lists of wineries. We listened to the 90 minute presentation and got a free bottle of wine, cash , a discount wine tasting card, and a gift cerfiticate to Christopher's Deli. We got a great picnic lunch at Christopher's and ate it at V. Sattui Winery. We enjoyed a visit to Copia. Also went to San Francisco and Point Reyes. They were far, but Riverpointe was a great central spot to see other sites in California.
